Entries.DialogueText: Is this a birthday gift? It's, uh... an interesting choice. Well I appreciate that you remembered me, anyway.
I don't usually get birthday gifts. This actually means a lot, . Thank you.
Oh, interesting... These books aren't very easy to come by in the valley.
Looks like there's a lot of good tips in here. Thanks, .
You're giving this... to me? I don't think I deserve it, but.. thank you.
Somehow, the old town minecart system started working again. It's very convenient for getting to and from the mines.
Don't get too cozy, though... if it can start up so suddenly, it could just as well shut down...
I... um... heard that you and Emily are together. Congratulations.
I've been feeling strangely hopeful lately.
Okay... I'll keep that in mind.
That's the problem... I do act natural... but I never have any success.
Did Emily say anything about our date the other day?
Wait, don't tell me... I'm better off not knowing. Maybe I can still salvage my dignity.
The weather doesn't really matter to me. I typically stay near my shop year-round.
Depressing, huh?
I should save up and buy a computer...
Maybe I can find a girlfriend on the 'internet'...
What? Don't judge me! Not everyone is a cool, attractive, socially-adept farmer, you know!
What's a guy like me supposed to do? *Groan*
It's situations like this where a person's true character is put to the test.
I'll keep Em... I mean, I'll keep everyone safe from the toxic rain!
I feel bad admitting it, but sometimes I wish there was a real disaster, not just some dumb green rain.
Something to shake everything up, you know?
Not that I want people to get hurt...
I just want to feel alive... To feel like I have a purpose...
Well that was a dud. And here I thought it was finally my chance to be a hero. Oh well... Back to the grindstone.
Er... hi. I'm Clint.
I'm the town blacksmith. If you ever need to upgrade your tools, I'm your guy.
is looking at the ground and won't say anything to you.
Interesting. There's tiny iridium flakes on your pickaxe... you've been going to the desert caves, huh?
I've always wanted to smelt with iridium. It's not easy to come by.
Ah, I can tell from the scratch marks on your pickaxe that you've reached a deeper layer of the mines.
If it starts getting difficult to break stones, you'll want to upgrade your pickaxe. I can help.
Yep. I'm a blacksmith.
My father was also a blacksmith.
My grandfather was a blacksmith as well.I bet you can't guess what my great-grandfather was...A blacksmith.A silly clown.A sarcastic jerk.
How'd you know?
Hahahaha. Good one.
And yes, my great-grandfather was also a blacksmith.
Wow. That was rude. I was just being funny and you took it to a whole new level.
Be glad you're a farmer, . It's nicer to work outdoors than by a hot furnace all day.
I'm only a blacksmith because my father pushed me into it.
I hate to say it, but sometimes I'm glad my father forced me to become a blacksmith. At least I have a profession.
If I didn't have work to do, I'd probably spend all day just sitting around feeling sorry for myself.
Hmm... That's an interesting stone, like nothing I've ever seen before.
I wouldn't know what to do with it, though. I deal in the mundane, not the magical...
*sigh*... We're all at the beach but I still feel so alone...
I'm hungry...
Ow... my whole torso is burnt to a crisp.
I'm gonna put on my special red trunks. They're supposed to be really eye-catching.
Well, that didn't turn out like I was imagining...
Oh no... I forgot to clip my toenails.
I thought working a furnace would have prepared me for this heat, but I'm sweating in places I didn't know I could.
I hope no one noticed...
body is glistening...
Sometimes I wonder how I ended up in this town.
How are your tools holding up?
If they ever need repairs, just come by my shop. I guarantee these tools for life!
Damn it, I'm too old to do anything exciting anymore. All I have to look forward to is years and years of sweaty, hot furnace-work.
Don't you have work to do?
So how are your tools holding up?
I don't know if people realize this, or care, but I do take a lot of pride in my work.
I mean... When I was a boy I didn't really dream of becoming a blacksmith. But that's what I am. And I want to be the best blacksmith I can be.
Business has been slow lately.
You should upgrade your tools. I could use the cash.
I heard Emily has a friend who lives in the desert. Do you know anything about her?
I wonder if she's single...
If you want me to upgrade your tools you'll have to give me the correct ore.
And you'll have to pay me a fee, of course.
Hey. What do you need?
Oh, hi . Sorry If I look a little messy. I've been working at the furnace all morning.
So, did you need anything, or do you just want to visit?
Uh... Hi there. Good morning.
I noticed that you've been breaking some rocks open and finding ore. That's good!
If you want to get the most out of the ores you find, you'll need a furnace.
Just so happens I had an extra set of blueprints lying around. Here, I want you to have them.
The furnace allows you to smelt metal bars. The bars can be used for crafting, construction, and tool upgrades.
When you've smelted a few copper bars, consider having me upgrade one of your tools. It can make your work a lot easier.
Well, okay. I'm heading home. Take it easy.
Learned how to craft a 'Furnace'
*gulp*... Okay, Emily. I'll do it.
Aww? Cute? ...*sigh*...
I couldn't do it! I don't wanna break out of my shell!
...Oh. I... I guess I'm interrupting something here, aren't I?
I understand. I'll leave now... Congrats, .
Oh no...
M...Me?

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun
Entries.DialogueText: Hello, ... care to join me?

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_1
Entries.DialogueText: Let me just go ahead and tell you what's on my mind.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_1_1
Entries.DialogueText: I have terrible luck with women, ...*sigh*

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_1_2
Entries.DialogueText: I'm a nice guy if you get to know me, I swear!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_2
Entries.DialogueText: The girls all seem to like you, ...

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_2_1
Entries.DialogueText: You're a girl, ...

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_3
Entries.DialogueText: 211 null 211 25 event_advice1 211 25 event_advice1 211 0 event_advice2 211 25 event_advice1#Treat women the same as men

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_4
Entries.DialogueText: Yes!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_5
Entries.DialogueText: Er.. I mean, I'll have the Big n' Cheesy. With extra sauce, please.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_5_1
Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_6
Entries.DialogueText: Er... *ahem* Th...Thanks, Emily. For... taking my order.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_6_1
Entries.DialogueText: Um, Emily? I was...*gulp*... I was wondering...

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_7
Entries.DialogueText: ... never mind.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_8
Entries.DialogueText: *sigh*

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Saloon/97/f Clint 750/t 1900 2300/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_8_1
Entries.DialogueText: I'm doomed...
...You caught me.
I was planning to ask Emily on a date. I was at her doorstep and everything... but then I heard her coming and I dove into this bush.
Now I'm waiting until she's done talking with Caroline so I can sneak back into my house.
Oh man...I'm so nervous.
What did you just say? You'll never upgrade your tools again if I don't ask her out?
You're a villain, .
*sigh* ...alright, I'll do it.
I gotta remember that advice gave me in the saloon.
Um... Emily?
I was wondering if you'd go w... with... tomorrow, me... *gulp*
I've got two tickets for the Grampleton Carnival tomorrow. W... Would you go with me?
Really? Okay! I'll pick you up at five.
Did you see that?! I've got a date tomorrow night!
Thanks for forcing me to do that, earlier. I'm scared, but also very pleased.
It's an old family recipe. I baked it right in the smelting oven.
Oh, um... I may have burnt the bottom a little, so... uh... you might have to peel off a layer of charred matter. But the rest is totally edible.
I'm sorry!
It's hard to remember my lines when her face is right in front of me like that...
No! It's not like that... This is just something I have to do. It's very important to me.
I've just got to try new 'Joja Bluu' cola.
It's got three times the sorbitol for a thick, sweet blast. And it's cheaper than water!

Have no fear, my dear. The world-class science team at Joja Headquarters have determined that 'Joja Bluu' does not cause a significant erosion of the stomach lining. So you can drink it whenever you like, as much as you like.
The real question is... 'When will YOU turn bluu?'... *glug* *glug*... Ahh...
Hey. Your tool is ready but you don't have any room in your inventory.
Um, I'm still working on your {0}. It won't be ready today.
...I found you unconscious in the mines. I think I blew my back out, dragging you all the way up here.
Be a little more careful next time, okay?
I complain about my job sometimes, but I do take pride in my work.These are some of my finest pieces. I hope you like them.

It's heartening to see others take an interest in my work. Makes me feel like I'm doing something good in the world.I finished some of these pieces just last week. Please inspect them closely, I stand behind my work!
One of my iridium-infused maces would make quick work of these things.
I already made it through the maze... now it's time to kick back with a pumpkin ale!...I'm trying my best to ignore the spider infestation behind me.
Is there any more food?
Oh no... *gulp*... It's mostly salad this year...
I wonder if Emily would dance with me?
*sigh* Everyone is partnered up... and here I am alone, once again...Ah well... I'll just drown my sorrows with some of that sweet and tangy jelly.
I'm full, but what else is there to do besides eat?
*munch* This festival always has the best food.
I wore my special shoes tonight... No one noticed.
I got too close to a wave, and it soaked my foot...
*sigh*... All these happy families. But for me, just another lonely year.
I could use some new blacksmithing tools. Mine have gotten a little rusty over the years.
Emily started helping me without any provocation... does that mean something? *gulp*
These lumps of snow won't form into balls...I think I'm better working in the heat than in the cold.
Yes! This is exactly what I've been looking for!
This is a fun gift. Thanks!
*Sigh*...
This makes me depressed.
Thanks.
